instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01814: What is 820-01814? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DOES NOT IGNITION DUE TO MOISTURE FILTRATION
threads.message: I have this equipment that I have reviewed everything and I do not have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> that is not shorted and comes from the <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>, but I have a doubt if the equipment is in dfu, does the <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> not generate that voltage? I say this because if the voltage in <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.6v it would be in dfu. it has something to do with <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> having 12v, 12.3v or 12.6v. When connecting the by-3200 device with a voltage of 20v and 2 amps, it gives me a source consumption of 0.092 and it stays there. Thank you

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DOES NOT IGNITION DUE TO MOISTURE FILTRATION
threads.message:
If all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present, machine should be recognized in DFU.
Be sure to follow all the steps from DFU tutorial linked on the forum.

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DOES NOT IGNITION DUE TO MOISTURE FILTRATION
threads.message: I have reviewed it and I have all the voltages of slps2r and awake up, I understand that it must be recognized in dfu but I understand that if it is a corruption in the ssd the line <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> if the equipment is in dfu it does not activate it from the pmu?

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DOES NOT IGNITION DUE TO MOISTURE FILTRATION
threads.message:
T2 corrupted firmware can break the power on sequence.
If you can't see it in DFU, no way to reflash its firmware.

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DOES NOT IGNITION DUE TO MOISTURE FILTRATION
threads.message: I have tried with a computer with a type c connector to try to start it in dfu mode but it does not recognize it, as you are told, the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> line is not activated and comes directly from the pm, understanding that it is the t2 dead or the pm wrong, what do you recommend I do?

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DOES NOT IGNITION DUE TO MOISTURE FILTRATION
threads.message:
Let the battery and charger both disconnected.
Be sure to use the proper USB-C port for DFU.
If still not recognized, then force it using SWK003 pads.
